meanings.definition: A type of clay pigeon shooting sport.
meanings.sent1: During the skeet competition, he hit every target.
meanings.sent2: My dad and I enjoy going skeet shooting on weekends.
meanings.sent3: At the skeet range, I pretend the clay pigeons are aliens invading Earth.
meanings.sent4: Her aim was so precise, it was like she could control the skeet with her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the skeet breaking in the air is music to my ears.

meanings.sent1: He accidentally skeeted on his new shoes.
meanings.sent2: The comedian made a joke about skeeting too soon.
meanings.sent3: When the water balloon burst, it skeeted all over the yard.
meanings.sent4: The volcano erupted, skeeting lava into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The chef's sauce skeeted out of the blender, creating a mess.

meanings.sent1: He always carries a lot of skeet in his wallet.
meanings.sent2: She earned a good amount of skeet from her part-time job.
meanings.sent3: I wish I had more skeet to buy that new video game.
meanings.sent4: The thief's eyes gleamed at the sight of all the skeet in the safe.
meanings.sent5: In the world of business, skeet talks louder than words.
